t: Prayer for the Punishment of the Wicked.
For the choir director; set to Al-tashheth. A Mikhtam of David.
Do*pn you indeed speak righteousness, O gods? Do*ln you judge uprightly, O sons of men?
No,*ln in heart you work unrighteousness; On*ln earth you weigh out the violence of your hands.
The*ln wicked are estranged from the womb; These*ln who speak lies go astray from birth.
They*ln have venom like the venom of a serpent; Like*ln a deaf cobra that stops up its ear,
So*ln that it does not hear the voice of charmers, Or*iln a skillful caster of spells.
O*ln God, shatter their teeth in their mouth; Break*ln out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord.*s
Let*ln them flow away like water that runs off; When*iln he aims his arrows, let them be as headless shafts.
Let*iln them*i be*i as a snail which melts away as it goes along, Like*iln the miscarriages of a woman which never see the sun.
Before*ln your pots can feel the*i fire*i of*i thorns He*ln will sweep them away with a whirlwind, the green and the burning alike.
The*ln righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance; He*ln will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
And*ln men will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous; Surely*ln there is a God who judges on earth!”
